input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Well, I guess I’ve been having this kind of nagging pain down there, and it’s been coming and going for a few months. My belly’s looking a bit bigger, and I feel full all the time, even if I haven’t eaten much. It’s kind of uncomfortable and weird, and I just wanted to check what’s going on.
output:
THINKING: The patient reports ongoing, intermittent nagging pain in the lower abdomen, increased abdominal size, and a constant feeling of fullness despite eating little. There were no new specific details provided in this segment, so these are consistent with previous symptoms. No additional confirmed facts have been introduced beyond what was previously summarized.

ANSWER: The patient has been experiencing a nagging, intermittent pain in the lower abdomen for a few months. They have noticed their belly looking bigger and feel full all the time, even with minimal eating.
